intro: Calycium scabrum, commonly known as the rough calycium, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its spiny, barrel-shaped stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a delicate touch to its rugged appearance. Calycium scabrum is typically found growing in rocky soils and is well adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its unique morphology and resilience make it a notable species in desert ecosystems.
